titles.title: Stop Enablers of Fraud Act
To restore aiding and abetting liability under the Federal securities laws.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Capital Markets, Insurance and Government Sponsored Enterprises.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

committee.subcommittee: Capital Markets, Insurance and Government Sponsored Enterprises
committee.name: House Financial Services

bill.summary: 10/10/2002--Introduced. Stop Enablers of Fraud Act - Amends the following Acts to impose liability for recklessly or knowingly providing substantial assistance towards aiding and abetting violations: (1) the Securities Act of 1933; (2) the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; (3) the Investment Company Act of 1940; and (4) the Investment Advisers Act of 1940.Shields from liability an omission or failure to act unless such omission or failure constitutes a breach of a duty owed by the relevant party.
